name: Atapakua - Mexican Vegetable Stew
description: Atapakua, this spicy Mexican vegetable stew from Michoacan is simmered in a smoky chile guajillo sauce made with pumpkin seeds, fresh corn, spearmint, garlic, and tomato.
recipeIngredient: 8 oz. Oyster or maitake mushrooms ((any mushroom will do))

itemListElement.text: Place sweet potato, zucchini, and chayote on a parchment lined sheet tray, season with salt and pepper.
itemListElement.name: Place sweet potato, zucchini, and chayote on a parchment lined sheet tray, season with salt and pepper.

itemListElement.text: Turn heat down to 350°F and bake for 20 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Turn heat down to 350°F and bake for 20 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Heat a large sauté pan to low heat and add 1 tbsp. of oil (if you are oil-free see notes). Add pumpkin seeds and chile guajillo and cook until golden brown, remove from pan and set aside. Add onion and garlic to pan and cook until golden brown (keep garlic whole).
itemListElement.name: Heat a large sauté pan to low heat and add 1 tbsp. of oil (if you are oil-free see notes). Add pumpkin seeds and chile guajillo and cook until golden brown, remove from pan and set aside. Add onion and garlic to pan and cook until golden brown (keep garlic whole).

itemListElement.text: In a small pot, simmer the corn in water until tender, about 2-3 minutes. Strain and reserve ¼ cup of the corn cooking liquid, and 1 tbsp. of corn kernels for garnish.
itemListElement.name: In a small pot, simmer the corn in water until tender, about 2-3 minutes. Strain and reserve ¼ cup of the corn cooking liquid, and 1 tbsp. of corn kernels for garnish.

itemListElement.text: Place the corn, chile guajillo, pumpkin seeds, onion, garlic, tomato, and ¼ cup of the corn water and blend until smooth.
itemListElement.name: Place the corn, chile guajillo, pumpkin seeds, onion, garlic, tomato, and ¼ cup of the corn water and blend until smooth.

itemListElement.text: Add 1 tbsp. of spearmint, season with salt and pepper, and blend again.
itemListElement.name: Add 1 tbsp. of spearmint, season with salt and pepper, and blend again.

itemListElement.text: Pour the sauce into a medium sauce pot, set to medium-low heat, and bring to a simmer. Simmer for 3-5 minutes, then turn off heat, cover and keep warm.
itemListElement.name: Pour the sauce into a medium sauce pot, set to medium-low heat, and bring to a simmer. Simmer for 3-5 minutes, then turn off heat, cover and keep warm.

itemListElement.text: In a large sauté pan set to medium high-heat, sauté the mushrooms until golden brown in avocado oil (oil is optional), about 6-7 minutes.
itemListElement.name: In a large sauté pan set to medium high-heat, sauté the mushrooms until golden brown in avocado oil (oil is optional), about 6-7 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Season with salt and pepper. Crush the avocado leaf in your hands and sprinkle it over the mushrooms.
itemListElement.name: Season with salt and pepper. Crush the avocado leaf in your hands and sprinkle it over the mushrooms.

itemListElement.text: Place the sautéed mushrooms in a large bowl or cazuela. Add the sweet potato, zucchini, and chayote.
itemListElement.name: Place the sautéed mushrooms in a large bowl or cazuela. Add the sweet potato, zucchini, and chayote.

itemListElement.text: Pour the sauce over the vegetables and stir.
itemListElement.name: Pour the sauce over the vegetables and stir.

itemListElement.text: Garnish with corn kernels, and spearmint leaves.
itemListElement.name: Garnish with corn kernels, and spearmint leaves.

itemListElement.text: Serve with your favorite beans and corn tortillas.
itemListElement.name: Serve with your favorite beans and corn tortillas.
